makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Spirit of the Ani (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the creature can give itself advantage on all weapon attack rolls, and gains resistance to bludgeoning piercing and slashing damage from non magical attacks. These effects last until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Spirit of the Ani (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the creature can give itself advantage on all weapon attack rolls, and gains resistance to bludgeoning piercing and slashing damage from non magical attacks. These effects last until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warrior makes two attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or  7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Spirit of the Ani (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the creature can give itself advantage on all weapon attack rolls, and gains resistance to bludgeoning piercing and slashing damage from non magical attacks. These effects last until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two attacks, or three shortsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Spirit of the Ani (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the creature can give itself advantage on all weapon attack rolls, and gains resistance to bludgeoning piercing and slashing damage from non magical attacks. These effects last until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: While mounted, the cavalryman has advantage on melee weapon attack rolls against creatures that are smaller than its mount. Additionally, the cavalryman only uses 5 feet of movement to mount and dismount a creature.

trait.name: Spirit of the Ani (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the creature can give itself advantage on all weapon attack rolls, and gains resistance to bludgeoning piercing and slashing damage from non magical attacks. These effects last until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cavalryman makes one lance attack, or two longbow attacks.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage, or 12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) piercing damage while mounted.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Retaliating Strike
entries: When a melee attack misses the cavalryman, it can use its reaction to make an attack at the creature that missed.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 25/100 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 3} piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The bog hound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Baleful Baying
entries: The bog hound bays magically. Every enemy within 300 feet of the hound that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the hound's next turn or until the hound is {@condition incapacitated}. A {@condition frightened} target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hound must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the hound as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A target that successfully saves is immune to the baying of all bog hounds for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Acid Absorption
entries: Whenever the troll is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regain any hit points this way. If the troll takes damage from a silvered weapon then it can't regain hit points from this trait until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

variant.name: Loathsome Limbs
entries: Whenever the troll takes at least 15 slashing damage at one time, roll a {@dice d20} to determine what else happens to it:

items.entry: One leg is severed from the troll if it has any legs left.
One arm is severed from the troll if it has any arms left.
The troll is decapitated, but the troll dies only if it can't regenerate. If it dies, so does the severed head.

entries: If the troll finishes a short or long rest without reattaching a severed limb or head, the part regrows. At that point, the severed part dies. Until then, a severed part acts on the troll's initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 13, 10 hit points, and the troll's Regeneration trait.
A severed leg is unable to attack and has a speed of 5 feet.

A severed arm has a speed of 5 feet and can make one claw attack on its turn, with disadvantage on the attack roll unless the troll can see the arm and its target. Each time the troll loses an arm, it loses a claw attack.

If its head is severed, the troll loses its bite attack and its body is {@condition blinded} unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of 0 feet and the troll's Keen Smell trait. It can make a bite attack but only against a target in its space.

The troll's speed is halved if it's missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls {@condition prone}. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bog walker's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Swampland Wayfarer
entries: The bog walker ignores natural difficult terrain in swamps and marshland.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the bog walker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the bog walker jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the bulette's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the bog walker's space.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the bog yeti has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bog yeti has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Frightening Gaze
entries: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and then be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute, the target is also {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition frightened} in this manner. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Vile Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the abominable bog yeti has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The abominable bog yeti has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yeti can use its Vile Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Frightening Gaze
entries: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage and then be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute, the target is also {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition frightened} in this manner. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to this yeti's gaze for 1 hour.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge}
entries: The yeti exhales a 30-foot cone of poisonous air. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlord is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Spirit of the Ani (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the creature can give itself advantage on all weapon attack rolls, and gains resistance to bludgeoning piercing and slashing damage from non magical attacks. These effects last until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Champion Challenge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the warlord issues a challenge to his combatants. Each creature of the warlord's choice that it can see within 30 feet of it is forced to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't willingly move more than 30 feet away from the warlord. This effect ends if the warlord is {@condition incapacitated} or if the creature is more than 30 feet away from the warlord.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warlord makes three attacks with its halberd or its longbow.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the swaashai goblins has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Swaashai Ghoul
senses: blindsight 30 ft. ({@condition blinded|phb|blind} beyond this radius)

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The ghoul has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the ghoul's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ghoul has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Blind Senses
entries: The ghoul can't use its blindsight while unable to smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Spirit of the Ani (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the creature can give itself advantage on all weapon attack rolls, and gains resistance to bludgeoning piercing and slashing damage from non magical attacks. These effects last until the end of the creature's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The priest makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Guided Strike (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The priest grants a +10 bonus to an attack roll made by itself or another creature within 30 feet of it. The priest can make this choice after the roll is made but before it hits or misses.

trait.name: Multiple Heads (Fen Hydra)
entries: The hydra has four heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken radiant damage since its last turn, or if it is in sunlight. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hydra can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the hydra's darkvision.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the swamp stomper moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the swamp stomper can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The swamp stomper can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The swamp stomper has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the swamp stomper can't use its tentacles on another target.

The swamp stomper is equal in size to an elephant, with blue-green scales, huge fin-like ears that fan out to either side of its tentacled head, allowing it to tread beneath the murky waters. Where an elephant may have a trunk, the swamp stomper has a singular long tentacle that it uses to grab unsuspecting prey while it hides under the dingy waters of swampland.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage in melee, or 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage at range.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The roc has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The giant heron doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The heron makes three attacks with its beak.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) damage and the target is {@condition grappled}. The heron can't make another beak attack while a creature is {@condition grappled} with this action.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The heron makes a beak attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the beak damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside of the heron's turns, and it takes {@damage 8d8} acid damage at the start of each of the heron's turns.

If the heron takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the heron must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the heron. If the heron dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.
